intro: Euphrasia salisburgensis proles cuprea, commonly known as the coppery eyebright, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are erect and often branched. The species is valued for its medicinal properties, traditionally used to treat eye conditions and inflammatory disorders.
